reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location right in the center of Paris. Very clean room, staff were friendly. Great value. I would recommend this to anyone staying in Paris.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is ideally located, its so central and considering we were in Paris during the strike and needed to walk everywhere it was a godsend! The hotel was lovely and clean, the room was comfortable and tastefully decorated, we even had a little balcony, the bathroom was clean and modern, it was a lovely room, much nicer than expected for the price we paid, the room was not as small as I expected from Parisian hotels, not that we spent much time in it! The staff were very friendly and helpful, particularly with our transport difficulties getting to Beauvais on a Wednesday morning with little or no metro running. The metro stop was only a few steps away from the hotel if we had been able to use it. We had a fantastic few days and were able to find our way around Paris so easily, we were minutes from Notre Dame, the Louvre and Musee D'Orsay. There are also loads of boutiques, restaurants and pubs in the area that are easy to find, the famous Boulevard St Germain (shopping) is a few minutes walk away.
reviews.title: Lovey hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a fantastic position & very close to many of the major sights. Rooms are clean and tidy but quite small - this was expected in Paris. The hotel staff were 'somewhat' helpful but could have been more friendly. I was ill & my husband attempted to order a cup of tea via room service (which they provided a menu) only to be told that they don't actually have room service. He finally got a cup of tea (although they dont have a kettle & heated the water in a microwave) & charged us $5 AUS dollars for the cup of water.
reviews.title: Great position, typically parisian staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we enjoyed our stay at the hotel, and if you are looking for a simple & clean hotel in Paris we would recommend it.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous location, exactly as described by previous reviews in tripadvisor. Spotless, up to date, wonderful breakfast- I think it is a much better deal than the bakery next door because of the neverending cafe au lait, croissants, pain au chocolat, lovely room and lovely waitress. Our only complaint was the noise late at night ( Friday and Saturday) and since the air conditioning was off . If you wanted some air in the room you had to open the window- when the window was shut , the noise was no problem- Took the RER train right from the airport and walked the 50 yards or less to the hotel- Great for a long weekend Walked to all the museums, le Marais district, etc...
reviews.title: A Nice Hotel, the best location !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for a long weekend in mid-January for our wedding anniversary. The location is absolutely perfect, on a pedestrian street round the corner from Notre Dame, opposite metro stop St Michel (direct line from Gare du Nord).
reviews.title: Great hotel - no complaints at all

reviews.text: I chose a special offer on an upgraded room, which was very nice: decent size, nice bathroom, everything perfectly clean.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, but even earplugs weren’t enough….

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was the bed was two singles put together, not a double as we had hoped. We gained more space by upgrading, but this meant twin beds sadly.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area is busy at night, which is good if you are nervous about secluded spots in unfamiliar cities. We did not suffer from noise as the previous reviewer did, although there were some street performers during the day and evening. Most activities ceased by midnight, but the occasional shout from passing people could disturb the lighter sleepers, I'm sure.
reviews.title: Great little hotel!

likes.disliked: — Room was a bit too warm at night

reviews.title: Great value for money!
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and helpful, and we couldn't fault the hotel's standards.

reviews.title: Great Experience
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Albe. This hotel has an exceptional staff, and a great location. I will definitely recommend this hotel to others. Thank you for helping to make our stay in Paris grand.

reviews.title: Right in the middle of the action-and so close to metros!!
reviews.text: This was exactly what I expected. The rooms are not large but spotlessly clean. The showerroom was small but perfect-- Large shower and so fresh and clean. You just walk out the door of the hotel and all life is there-bookshops -boulangerie-restaurants-take away and sit in- felt very safe despite being so lively. Was surprised how quiet the rooms were at night-thought with the street outside being so busy it might be a problem . Would stay again. Just a stroll to Notre Dame-slightly longer to Musee d'Orsay -short stroll to Saint Chapelle( do not miss this--it is breathtaking)
Small hotel with excellent staff in the right position
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location. Lots to do and see with in minutes walk. The smell of the bakery on the corner in the morning was an added charm. The streets below the hotel are busy with people in the evening but the rooms are sound proofed enough that it wasn't a problem. Great friendly staff and very convenient wi-fi access too.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: good location nice corner room wih a view but without any noise interffearance stuff was nice and helpfull
reviews.title: good location nice room

reviews.text: I have had the te pleasure of visiting Paris many times, and have stayed in all manner of hotels and apartment rentals. I have recommended D'Albe St. Michel to my friends for years for its perfect location (Place St. Michel, literally a stone's throw from Notre Dame, and almost atop the St. Michel Metro entrance which serves the same Metro line as Gare du Nord and the RER line for the Eiffel Tower) and its pristine servicable service standards. This is the hotel for any visit that puts a premium on being out and about. D'Albe St. Michel is a fantastic value...almost too good to be true given its location and standards. Sure, teeny tiny rooms (but not abnormally so), and no services (offers a continental breakfast in the lobby, if you somehow find the bakery just outside the hotel's entrance to be too good to experience), and sure it practically anchors the restaurant alley, but there is absolutely no risk in the D'Albe St. Michel. If you want better restaurants, the Metro will wisk you whereever your heart desires, and practically all 4/5/6 Arrondissement restaurants are within a 15-minute walk at most, and most far closer. Sure, you can pay more and get more, but if your time in Paris is to be spent outside of the hotel, you can't do better than D'Albe St. Michel.
reviews.title: Just about perfect for a burst visit to Paris

likes.disliked: — Standard American criticism...would prefer a queen bed to 2 singles pushed together.

reviews.text: Spent 3 nights in a triple room overlooking the wonderful, energy filled streets around St Michel and with a glimse of the river. The hotel is clean, staff excellent, good breakfast and the rooms are of reasonable size. The location is excellent being close to St Michel Metro, hundreds of restaurants and a stroll to everywhere. I can recommend this one.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Hotel D'Albe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. Right beside a metro stop but you can walk to all the central sights. Surrounded by restaurants. As others mention you may wish to take ear plugs if you are easily woken by noise.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: Contrary to others we were not impressed by downstairs bakery- ok for convenience but produce nowhere as nice as you could get elsewhere- try the markets 5min east along Bld St Germain.
reviews.title: Gorgeous little Gem in Prime location

reviews.text: Overall would recommend and would return next time in Paris.
reviews.title: location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Considering how much luggage we had after shopping in London and Italy !! we found this hotel very easy to find and the location was perfect.
reviews.title: Superb location

likes.disliked: — Staff didn't converse much in English

reviews.text: It is walking distance (something like 80m) from the metro and RER so you can get anywhere very easily.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — staff was not very friendly - expect more from a small hotel

reviews.text: The room was quite good. Breakfast was not included (and the price for breakfast was not worth it) which was fine as downstairs there was a lovely place to buy breakfast.
reviews.title: albe treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is located right in the heart of St Michel, there are tonnes of restaurants nearby so was very convenient if we had had a really long day and just wanted to grab something quick for dinner.
reviews.title: Quiet, clean and well run
Great Service!!
reviews.text: Since it is right in the heart of everything sometimes it was a little noisy in the night but that didn't bother us too much as we closed the windows and put the aircon on. Also, as per most places in Paris the hotel staff don't speak much English.
With regards to the issue of street noise – no problem for us. Excellent double glazing plus our high floor kept out just about all of the noise. It really was astonishingly quiet.
reviews.title: Excellant accomodation, perfect location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I note differences of opinion on the level of noise in other reviews, for which I have a theory. D’Albe is on the corner of two streets, Rue de la Harpe and (I think) Rue Hachette, in a typically triangular Parisien building. The former street is relatively quiet, whereas the latter is lined with restaurants of the noisy persuasion. If you end up with room on a low floor over the noisy street, you might be in trouble, however good the double glazing. On the other hand, Rue de la Harpe is just sheltered enough to preserve the rooms from the noise. I understand that all rooms bar some singles face one of these two roads. We were lucky, and therefore it was blissfully quiet for the middle of Paris.
reviews.title: Perfect for exploring Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn’t do breakfast in the hotel: it’s expensive, and you can get fresh and excellent petit dejeuner at the Restaurant Saint Severin opposite the hotel for far less (and sit outside to boot). Alternatively, if you are off to the Louvre or the Orsay for opening time, try the wonderful La Fregate on the corner of Rue du Bac directly over the river from the Louvre for some proper Paris style.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in the Latin Quarter

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is awesome. There is a bakery right next door to the hotel. Great croissants and crepes. Also, there are ample of restaurants to choose from within the vicinity of the hotel. As the hotel faced a busy street, it was noisy at night and difficult to sleep but we managed to sleep through all that noise.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.liked: — Location and the rooms were very clean
likes.disliked: — Daytime Front desk service was terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms as per Canadian standards was small but we did find it was not cramped and was still spacious. The bathrooms were very clean except the bathtubs did not have shower curtains. That was a challenge to try and take a shower without getting the bathroom floors flooded.
reviews.title: Fantastic location
A great Hotel
reviews.text: The only complaint I would have is the front desk person (daytime) was very unfriendly and not very helpful. We had asked him for some directions and he was very rude and not helpful at all. However, the lady running the breakfast room was very cheerful and very friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel as the location is in the Latin Quarter.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: R.Amlani, Edmonton, Canada
reviews.title: Great Central Location

likes.liked: — Spotless, updated rooms; great value for central location

reviews.text: Our initial greeting at reception was quite friendly but on checkout we had different staff who were in fact rude. The breakfast was excellent & the girl who ran the breakfast room was extemely friendly & obliging.The location was excellent - 2 minute walk to the underground & very close to Notre Dame. The rooms were very clean & on the small side but typical for Paris. I feel it was expensive for what it was & I was not impressed by the rude receptionist.
reviews.title: It was ok

likes.liked: — The breakfast & staff in the dining room

reviews.text: We had 2 kids aged 6 and 2 with us and stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in early Feb. The hotel is a 3 star but the location is rather central. Like most hotels in this city, rooms come in small sizes and of course the lift is almost non-existent or too small to fit more than 2 adults! To be objective, I will list the good and not-so good points.
reviews.title: Lift not working

likes.disliked: — Walking 6 flights of stairs to get to my room!

reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: Woke up to someone having nicked my bag from my room

likes.disliked: — being robbed in my room while i was sleeping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception was friendly and allowed us to keep the baby stroller with them so it won't take up additional space in our room.
reviews.title: Great,Great,Great

likes.disliked: — The rooms was a bit small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The heating was efficient and can be adjusted. The bathroom though small had a heater next to the tub/shower. The decor looked clean and modern.
reviews.title: Excellent Location
Great Location
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel D'Albe St Michel for two nights in September. The room, although small, was perfectly adaquate for two people. The bathroom was clean, and fresh towels were supplied on our second day. The service at reception was welcoming and they even allowed us to leave our baggage with them on the day of our departure, so that we could take in a few last sights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location could not be better. Just across the road from the tube station and a 2 minute walk from Notre Dame. We will definitely be back and would reccommed this hotel to our friends and family.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Great Hotel! very clean, perfectly located. We were in a superior room, where the view was to the senna river. The hotel is very closed of metropolitan and RER, and only five minutes (or less) to Notre Dame Cathedral. We are sure that we will repeat this hotel the next time that we come back to Paris. Thanks for all.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a room for me and my sisters at the Albe because the hotel we usually stay at was fully booked. As it turned out, we will be staying at the Albe for future visits. The Junior suite was spacious and the bathroom very nice. The location, around the corner from St.Michel, was perfect. We usually had breakfast at the bakery which is located on the ground floor of the hotel building, very convenient. But on the last day we decided to have breakfast at the hotel, which I can reccommend. The service at the hotel was very friendly and everything succeded our expectations. I would highly reccommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I always love staying at the Hotel D'Albe. The Location right in the middle of the Latin Quarter is perfect for exploring Paris. You are within walking distance of Notre Dame, the Louvre, and right on the river Seine in the middle of the city. The hotel has great service and the rooms are very nice and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: When can I return?

likes.disliked: — Small Room, but not too bad

reviews.text: This is a great hotel smack in the middle of the latin quarter in Paris. The room was clean, the staff were really sweet and helpful and they were quite happy to speak english when we proved that our french vocabulary only consisted of "bonjour" and "merci"... We we're impressed at how quiet the room was, even though its windows faced a busy street. The room was air conditioned, it had a handy safe, the bathroom was small, but clean. We didn't have breakfast included in our package, but had breakfast the morning we were leaving, and even that impressed us. The location is absolutely wonderful (if you do like staying in an area that never sleeps!). There are plenty of restaurants close to the hotel. The street just outside the hotel is a real tourist trap, so we decided to walk a bit further away to find more authentic Paris restaurants. Bld St Germain is really close, as is Bld St Michel, and in the less busy side streets you can find great places to eat. The Notre Dame is just a few minutes away, and the metro stops St Michel and Cluny are just round the corner. The RER train (regional train) connects St Michel to both Charles de Gaulle and Orly Airport, which is really handy. If you think location is important and also value a decent standard hotel, I'd choose this one. Enjoy!
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — The bathroom solution not the best, the floor was pretty wet after a shower

reviews.text: We booked the Albe for two reasons: location and the fact it had a family room (something I found hard to find in Paris). In short, we weren't disappointed. The triple room was spotless, comfortable with good furnishings and flat screen TV. The bathroom was again spotless (a benchmark of hotels I always feel) with good size bath, shower over etc.. Location for us was perfect, right in the heart of the hustle and bustle of the Latin Quarter, walking distrance to lovely bistros and virtually on the Seine by Notre Dame. Short walk to St Michel Metro and RER made it the perfect stop off between Disney and home for the night. Even though our room was on the first floor above the little tea room next to the hotel reception the street noise was barely audible. Would definitely stay again and would recommend for families.
reviews.title: Would stay again
Great Value & Location
reviews.text: The Hotel D'Albe St Michel was great value for money and a fabulous vacation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the hotel from October 11-21, 2007 and our initial reaction was that the rooms were not unlike a cruise ship...very small, cramped, with tiny hallways leading to the rooms. However we discovered that the rooms were immaculate, and had everything that we needed. We had friends staying at the Ritz during the metro strike & our location was so much easier to walk get to things without transportation that we felt that we lucked out.
reviews.title: Je'taime paris et l'hotel albe

reviews.text: Coming from North America we are getting used to smoke free enviromnets so if you are challenged with smoke this is not the place for you. We were on a no smoking floor, however I think most Europeans don't care & smoke in whatever room they want so that was likely the only discomfort we experienced as it definately wafted into our room.
reviews.title: Great find, as central as you can get

reviews.text: The location was so convenient to the Metro, all types of banks, ATMs, restaurants, music, entertainment. We could not have asked for more. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Location of the Albe Hotel was extremely convenient. Had a wonderful stay.

reviews.text: The hotel & staff were very professional and helpful. Despite all previous warnings about the noise level; it really did not bother us.
reviews.title: Great location, in vibrant area!
As good as it gets
reviews.text: Expect a very tiny elevator -- only one person with two bags will fit. But this was really a very minor inconvenience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area around St.Michel/Notre Dame has a vibe unlike any other part of Paris. Everyone has a different objective or assumption of what Paris will be like and for me this area fullfills the ideals I had in my head. The hotel less so, but it is a safe, clean resting place to lay your weary head after a busy Paris-like filled day. Luckily we stayed on the first floor so only made the mistake of using the lift once to take up our luggage. However after having stayed in numerous 3 star hotels in Paris I can assure you this is the norm. Also our 'non-smoking' room was equipped with an ashtray.
reviews.title: Our 5th stay at the D'Albe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise this hotel is a find. I got a winter promotion so feel it was worth the price I paid. The staff in the evening wasn't overly friendly or helpful, but not generally offensive. One tip would be if travelling in a pair and not a couple, you might want to book a twin room instead of a double as sharing the double with my aging mother proved to be a bit close for comfort ;)
reviews.title: Great Location to explore Paris

reviews.text: Very good hotel in a touristic area of Paris but my room was quiet and extremely spacious. Nice people at recption and breakfast room.
reviews.title: PARIS - Hotel d'Albe

likes.liked: — Very good hotel in a touristic area of Paris but my room was quiet and extremely spacious.Nice people at recption and breakfast room.

reviews.title: a stay in the heart of Paris
reviews.text: The room although small was neat, the facilities pristine, and the staff always pleasant, available and helpful. Breakfast at the hotel was a nice way to start the day..
Location is almost everything in trip. This hotel is located in very convenient area to everywhere. 5 minute walk to Metro, Notre dame is also 5-10, City hall is also, even to Saint Germain.
reviews.title: Good location, cozy rooms

reviews.text: You can find 'almost' everything you want in walking distance from the hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and great nightly rate.
Location !!
reviews.text: Staffs are very friendly,I had some troubles with my credit card but they were all helpful.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Value
reviews.text: Great service, great location, steps away from Metro stop that is on a good line and has direct RER airport service. Price very reasonable. Can't ask for much more. Saw that someone else mentioned noise -- the neighborhood is fairly noisy, but the windows are thick and appear new. Perhaps a recent upgrade -- noise wasn't a problem and room faced the street.

This hotel was at a great location, about a block from the metro, but was also within walking distance of Notre Dame and great cafes and restaurants. The room was standard size from what I've seen in European cities, but absolutely immaculate, especially the bathroom. The hotel staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again the next time I'm in Paris.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Hotel D'Albe St. Michel.

likes.disliked: — The elevator was a little small.

reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel in a perfect location in Paris!
reviews.title: wonderful first experience

reviews.text: The rooms (at least on the 5th floor where I was) themselves are clean, more or less quiet, spacious enough, fairly new. The bathrooms are all new and impeccably clean. The staff was courteous and spoke good enough English to communicate with easily. We did not eat in the restaurant as there are so many other restaurants in the area to choose from, but the menu looked nice and so did the breakfast, from what we saw. The price was also fair considering you are mere blocks away from Notre Dame, the Seine, the Isle de France, and all the other attractions over there. You are also in the middle of the lovely winding old streets of the Quartier Latin with wonderful restaurants and bars also reasonably priced.
reviews.title: weekend off with my sons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definitely stay there again the next time I am in Paris.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

likes.disliked: — Cleaner came in the room about 9am daily to see if the room could be cleaned

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ill be honest Im not one to write reviews, but this is an Ideal hotel to stay at if you are looking for a central place. Train station is 30 sec walk and notre dame is a 10 min walk. My fiance and I wanted a clean clean clean place to stay at but we werent looking for anything fancy. We only had 4days to really get to know Paris. Located in the middle of 100's of restaurants and bars we felt that we had chosen the perfect place. I recommened the green line tour buses even if you dont want to listen to their tour guide (earphone thingamagigs) its ideal as a a taxi. For 2 day tickets its around $45euros and for a day its around $40. It runs throught out all major attractions. The hotel staff is friendly. Their is an AWESOME bakery attached to the hotel (cheaper and better than breakfast at hotel) Great place if you are not looking for a RItz.
reviews.title: Ideal place to stay
Great find
reviews.text: I have just returned from a quick, overnight stay with my teenage daughter at this great little hotel in Paris.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read the reviews, we requested a room with a view and with a bathroom and shower. We had a twin room on the fifth floor, with a wonderful view towards the Seine from a small balcony. The room wasn't large, but plenty big enough for us and had a mini bar, flatscreen tv and safe. The decor was simple and modern, and to our taste. The beds were comfortable.
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Again, although small (including a shorter length bath), the bathroom was sparklingly clean and modern which for me is more important, with plenty of hot water.
reviews.title: Good Location - Recommended

reviews.text: The entrance lobby was bright, modern and clean, with some welcoming leather seating and magazines. We arrived early, and the hotel offered to store our bags. Our room was ready by 12.30pm. It was warm in the daytime even in March, but this allowed us to have the windows open. Not sure about how it would be in the heat of the summer (see other reviews). The staff were wonderfully helpful, and gave a very good restaurant recommendation - always a test.
reviews.title: Central location, spotless room

likes.liked: — Location, spotless room, breakfast room lady

reviews.text: Myself and my parents stayed at this hotel near the end of April. We only had a short time in Paris so wanted somewhere central where we could see all the sites in a short space of time.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was brilliant. It was right next to the River Seine and within walking distance of the Notre Dame, Lourve etc. We hardly had to even get a Metro pass for our time there.
reviews.title: Paris in the Spring!!!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff and cleanliness of room

reviews.text: It's been a year since we stayed but (as we plan our next trip) the memory is still one of a great stay and a great hotel to which we would readily return.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved our stay at the D'albe

reviews.text: When people say its close to Notre Dame - look at my pictures - the location is perfect.
reviews.title: Htel D'Albe is a mixed bag

reviews.text: It really gave us the feeling of being in Paris - as others reassurred you about soundproofed windows, we opened them wide to take in the buzz of the life in the Latin quarter.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rather than have breakfast at the hotel itself, we bought croissants , pain du chocolat and espresso at the bakery adjoining the hotel and enjoyed this in our room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: Mentioning Tripadvisor never goes astray as we were upgraded to the corner suite with a balcony with views to St Michel square and the Seine .
reviews.title: For Paris, pretty good!!

likes.disliked: — The expensive wifi and the key drop!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: Great Location
We loved the A
reviews.text: I wouldnt even look for another hotel if I visit Paris again as this one is just perfect for the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot recommend it highly enough.
reviews.title: Wondeful stay in Paris

likes.liked: — The proximity to many of the popular sites.
likes.disliked: — The street noise in the evening.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was not the first time we stayed at the Hotel d'Albe. We returned because it was found to be excellent during a previous stay and this at a prime location (Quartier latin).
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location!
great little hotel
reviews.text: This time we stayed there during the strikes (metro, opera...). Our previous experience was not only confirmed: excellent location, nice rooms, very good service. On top of that we met very frienly and helpful people, and this starting with a really nice breakfast served with a beautiful smile.

Very good location on Place St. Michel. Rooms average in size but clean and well kept. The street noise mentioned by some reviewers could be a concern for older travellers but for me it was not a problem. Good value for money.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: A super location for just about everything central in Paris. Staff very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Super spot.
Spot On & Spotless
reviews.text: Not one to write these types of reviews generally but would like

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: to leave a few comments on the Hotel D'Albe ( Rue De La Harpe ) as accommodation in city centres can often be hit and miss. Went with my wife and my parents for short break via Eurostar to celebrate my mother's 70th birthday and can only say experience was superb. Staff were very helpful with all travel ,restaurant and river cruise bookings - as said location ideal,premises were very clean and would definitely recommend to any friends/family in the future.
reviews.title: Albe Back!!

reviews.text: Just returned back from another fantastic stay at Hotel D'Albe right in the heart of the Latin Quarter. We discovered the hotel during our last stay in Paris. The Hotel is a stones throw away from St Michel Metro but despite it's central location, right in the heart of 'the biz', the sound proofing is fantastic, although you do tend to spend most of the time with your window open to let in all the fabulous sounds and smells. The staff are very friendly and accommodating and will allow you to muddle your way through your limited French before rescuing you with their far better English!
reviews.title: Loved the hotel D'Albe super location !
Left Bank Charm
reviews.text: The D'Albe hotel was a super way to end our two week vacation to Normandy, for the two nights of September 13th and 14th, 2007 .I picked it because of the great reviews on Trip Advisor and easy to find from the airport where our tour ended. We took the RER from and to the airport and 30 minutes we were in a nice hotel room watching the busy Latin quarter bustle from our window. We had a large room on the first floor with 3 large windows for viewing the streets at night. My husband, who is quite picky, said that our two nights at the D'Albe were one of the highlights of the trip. With the windows closed it was very peaceful and very quiet. A very special thanks to Cecile and the rest of the friendly staff at the D'Albe for making our ending to our France trip enjoyable. Tripadvisor member from the state of Nevada

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: I have stayed in the Hotel d'Albe several times previously and found it well up to standard. The room was comfortable, the staff pleasant and helpful and the breakfast excellent. My only complaint (a very minor one) was that it was very difficult to take a shower without flooding the bathroom floor as there was no shower curtain or screen at the shower end of the bath. The designer had, for reasons best known to him or her, put the screen at the other end!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I should certainly return to the hotel.
reviews.title: Hotel D-Albe: Best Personnel, Service, Accommodations for Paris Visit

reviews.text: E-mail correspondence with Alexandre was superb in setting up 6-night accommodations & assuring that expectations were met. Room was very clean, modern, comfortable with adequate space in city renown for lesser accommodations. Entire staff was very helpful & accurate with every query or assistance requested. Perfect location next to St Michel for using Metro to get everywhere: direct route to Versailles, Eiffel Tower, etc. Rate reasonable. Would rebook......absolutely.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a good position

likes.disliked: — Price/Services rate high (no breakfast and WiFi included)

reviews.title: Enjoyed the Hotel D'Albe
reviews.text: Hotel clean and staff helpful. Perfect position close to Notre Dame, Saint Germain and metro stop. Perfect for a walk or to jog along the Seine. Of course a bit noisy in the evening but not that much. Price is high for low budget travellers but for a couple I think is a good solution.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very cute no-frills hotel in the heart of the Latin Quarter. Small but tidy rooms. Right above a delicious bakery. Lots of action right out the door--cafes, bakeries, restaurants, and lots of people. I would absolutely recommend this hotel based solely on location. How much time do you spend in the hotel room in Paris anyway?
reviews.title: very cute hotel in latin quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 6 day stay at the Hotle Albe. We thought that the hotel was ideally located in the Quartier Latin, with loads of atmosphere and ambiance in the area. There is a space just up the road from the hotel where street performers tend to work. There were break dancers and a brilliant guy on a guitar that added a real bohemian buzz to the locality. There are loads of lovely coffee shops and cheap restaurants near the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect Location!

reviews.text: We were a little disapppointed with our room as we had a twin instead of a double room. We threw down our bags and went for something to eat because we had been on the go for about 6 hours. On returning we asked were there any double rooms but were told that we should have asked to change within the first 15 minutes after booking in. I wasn't really impressed with the tone of the guy at reception, but all the women on reception during the day were lovely.
reviews.title: Nice hotel. great location!
Best Location
reviews.text: The room was very clean and the girls did a great job keeping it tidy during our stay.

Don't go to this hotel if you want a sleep-in in the morning. Ten o clock was the latest we slept with kids playing in the corridor, people having full blown conversations outside our door and people shouting at each other down the hall.
reviews.title: Paris, Paris, Paris....
Brilliant location
reviews.text: Simple, clean, efficiant hotel in an ideal location for restaurants and attractions. Metro nearby too. Stayed there with family and also for a rugby weekend.
One word of warning.....don't go to Aarapana Indian Restaurant nearby. It was dreadful!
reviews.title: Albe'back

reviews.text: The Hotel D'Albe is a gem of a hotel for a number of reasons. I didn't expect anything special from this 3 star accommodation as it was booked as a last minuite solution for the France v Scotland rugby weekend I had planned.
reviews.title: Good but noisy

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is perfect, just around the corner from Notre Dame. The hotel is slightly inset from the main road in a cobbled area within the "latin quarter" which is quietly bustling during the day with parisian shops, some lovely small cafes and restaurants. The metro is only 20 yards away for all your other sightseeing needs.
reviews.title: Excellent location in the heart of the Latin Quarters
superb!!
reviews.text: On entry to the hotel it was clean and immaculate, with a geniunely friendly welcome. Although small, the room was situated on the top floor and had a separate toilet and washroom. There was ample cupboard space, comfy beds and I was suprised to find a mini fridge that contained a nice selection of beer and bottled water (that was to save me later on) at a relatively cheap price for a minibar. There was also a state of the art flatscreen TV to watch so that I could brush up on the Francais! Not at all bad for a 3 star place and at a fantastic cost for a weekend. Unfortunately it was not such a great rugby experience but with regards to the hotel, all I can say is .........Albe'back!!!!

reviews.title: Lovely hotel in the Latin Quarter
reviews.text: Front desk people are excellent and speak many different languages. Rooms cozy and clean. Great location in the Latin Quarter. The neighborhood has restaurants and taverns galore...some at fairly reasonable prices, so you can easily pop in after a long day of sightseeing. And you are literally one block away from taking a train, subway or bus anywhere in the city and beyond. Would recommend, even though at times, noise from the street did drift in a bit, and the beds were a bit narrow, but that's just an aside for those who care. Enjoy Paris!

We stayed at the Hotel Albe for two nights with a room on the 4th floor. The room was very clean and modern but quite stuffy (despite turning off all heating appliances). We could not open the window due to street noise, which we could still hear despite the double glazing.
reviews.title: Fine Hotel, Great Location

likes.disliked: — if I have to say anything, smallish bathrooms but I'm freakishly huge & *I* managed, so stop complaining!

reviews.text: While in Paris, I stayed in two different hotels (Hotel Muguet and this one), this being the latter and the better (from 12/12 - 12/14/07). We booked a triple room which came with: 1 double bed, 1 single bed, a flat screen TV (2 English-speaking channels), safe box, and a large-sized-for-Europe bathroom (equipped with standing shower, hair blow dryer and heated towels!!) The only downside to the room is that wireless internet connection is not free. (They sell access cards at the front desk and there is also an internet cafe around the corner from the hotel.) The front-desk folks are extremely nice and helpful!
reviews.title: Simply Fabulous! (heated towels, great location - what could be better?)
LOVED this hotel and Paris!!!
reviews.text: The surrounding area can only be described as perfect! The area is very lively in the evenings and very safe during the day; we did a few morning runs along the River Seine, which is just a stones throw away. Right downstairs from you is a bakery for your morning croissant and coffee. On every street flanking the hotel, around every corner, and across the way are plenty of souvenir and Parisian shops (Etam, Cote a Cote). There are also numerous restaurant choices all around, a French book shop right across the hotel door entrance, and for those aching for a "regular" sized coffee by American standards, there is even a Starbucks just 2-3 minute walk away (although I preferred the downstairs bakery)!

Just arrived back. Friends had booked this hotel for location. I can honestly say I will go back to this hotel every time I go back to Paris. The room we had was more than adequate good size and very clean. Staff were very helpful. Full marks.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: We just returned from a 4 night stay and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Paris. The hotel was in a great location with a taxi stand, metro, and RER stations plus the Seine and Notre Dame right around the corner. The decor was tasteful and everything was clean and fresh plus the beds were comfortable - and best of all for the warm days we were there - the air conditioning works very well! The hotel exceeded my expectations, especially for the price paid.
reviews.title: Highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. With in walking distance of all the great sites. Very nice people at the front desk. Helped with restaurants that were very good. The rooms are very small but that is just Paris. The rooms are clean, the hotel in general was spotless. Breakfast was the best we had in France. Good variety from eggs, cheese, ham, cereal and fruit. Down side is the location in a busy young area. Rooms were quiet enough but the party atmosphere goes on until the wee hours of the morning. Overall, I would definitely stay at the Albe again.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Great hotel in a superb position in centre of Paris. Room was modern and clean, Breakfast more than adequate.
reviews.title: Oh La La!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have used the hotel before and will continue to do so in future.
reviews.title: Ideal Location for first time in Paris
